Title: Life of a Red Blood Cell

Heart.Body: You're in the heart, the powerful pump of the circulatory system. The rhythmic beating surrounds you as you're pushed through chambers.

Lungs.Body: You've arrived in the delicate alveoli of the lungs. All around you, oxygen molecules are binding to hemoglobin.

Blood Stream.Body: You're flowing through the blood vessels of the body.
Blood Stream.None: Your hemoglobin is empty - you need to visit the lungs to pick up oxygen.
Blood Stream.Carrying: Your hemoglobin is saturated with oxygen molecules. Look for organs that need oxygen delivery!

Choices.Text: Deliver oxygen to the rest of the body

Brain.Body: You've reached the brain, the body's control center. Neurons eagerly accept your oxygen payload.

Liver.Body: The liver's immune cells (Kupffer cells) watch carefully...

PossibleEvents: Kupffer cells glare at you suspiciously
You hear a mysterious gurgling sound

Gut.Body: You've arrived in the intestines. The digestive system needs oxygen to function properly.

Rest of Body.Body: You're delivering oxygen to muscles and other tissues throughout the body.
